Hi Nansi,

Apologies for the delayed response.

We've now implemented a validation that checks both the selected delivery date and the current time during the checkout process. This ensures that if an order is placed after 11:00 AM, the system will prompt users to select a delivery date from the next day onward — helping to prevent any scheduling conflicts.

Please see the sample screenshot below that illustrates the validation message a customer would see if they attempt to select same-day delivery after the 11:00 AM cutoff:

action.text: Workflow **1 week old ticket tag as urgent** was triggered
Workflow **1 week old ticket tag as urgent** was triggered

full_threads.body:
This ticket has been open for over 5 days. If action is still required, please prioritize it. Otherwise, kindly provide an update and confirm it can be closed.

If you need to respond to the client, please create a new conversation and close this ticket. Once the new ticket is created, continue the conversation there.

For guidance, refer to this walkthrough:
  • https://www.loom.com/share/238808eaaeaa428a80a85441547b7e50?sid=1e84bd29-3621-4f82-8dac-5237bd08e5a5

@joel + @ricaR - did we get to the bottom of this?

We should close out with Nansi regardless. Please let me know if I can help draft.

This ticket has been idle for over 24 hours.

If you need to respond to the client, please create a new conversation and close this ticket. Once the new ticket is created, continue the conversation there.

For guidance, refer to this walkthrough: 
  • https://www.loom.com/share/238808eaaeaa428a80a85441547b7e50?sid=1e84bd29-3621-4f82-8dac-5237bd08e5a5
  • https://www.loom.com/share/b1f338d04eb44b118d915b107a6ed087?sid=1dbc4938-b676-4cd2-a748-5692874039dc

Hi Nansi,

Thanks for bringing this to our attention.

We're currently in the process of investigating how this happened. Our initial assessment is that the customer may have added the items to their cart earlier in the morning and only completed the checkout process after the 11:00 am cut-off—at 11:18 am in this case.

We're testing this scenario now and working on implementing a validation step at the time of submission to prevent orders from being accepted for AM delivery if they’re submitted after the cut-off.

We’ll keep you updated as we progress.
